Description: Fragment of flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora at neck join, downturning. Clay fine light orange-red. Circular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 206, 10 or 201, 11. Name Boethos. Perhaps from same die as Alexandria Museum, ALEX ABC 0918.34. Same die as 1925.0119,459.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0419)
